candies.name: Nerds
candies.desc: Julies Favorite Candy! Nerds flavors range from Strawberry, Grape, Orange, Watermelon, and Lemonade

candies.name: Snickers
candies.desc: A classic chocolate bar with peanuts, caramel, and nougat, produced by Mars, Inc. Since 2021. Snickers has made $423.74 million in sales

candies.name: Skittles
candies.desc: Colorful fruit-flavored candies produced and marketed by the Wrigley Company (a subsidiary of Mars, Inc.)

candies.name: Kit Kat
candies.desc: The 'Gimmie A Break' ad jingle first aired in 1986, Melissa loves this one!

candies.name: Twix
candies.desc: A chocolate bar made with a biscuit base, caramel, and milk chocolate coating. The word 'Twix' is actually a mashup of 'twin bix,' 'bix' being British shorthand for biscuits

candies.name: M&M's
candies.desc: M & M's stands for Mars and Murrie. Colorful button-shaped chocolates produced by Mars, Inc. The first factory was in New Jersey

candies.name: Reese's Peanut Butter Cups
candies.desc: A popular peanut butter and chocolate confection produced by The Hershey Company. By popular we mean #1 selling candy in the United States

candies.name: ButterFinger
candies.desc: A crispety, crunchety, peanut buttery candy bar made by Ferrero. Not to mention Josh's favorite chocolate bar

candies.name: Gummy Bears
candies.desc: Originally called 'Dancing Bears', first invented in Germany in the 1920s. Chewy and fruity these gummies didn't make it to America until the 1980s

candies.name: Hershey's Chocolate Bar
candies.desc: Said to be soldiers favorite chocolate bar during WW2, they could maintain their shape for over an hour in 120 degree heat
